intro: Emblemantha, commonly known as the moonflower, is a striking plant characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is native to tropical regions of the Americas. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Emblemantha thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
